utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Do you think that there’s a town in Missouri or some place called Sample? And ah, as you’re driving into town there’s-there’s like a sign, and it says “You’re in Sample.”

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: How’d it go with Pete?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Tell us!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’re not gonna believe this. Okay, so I go over...

utterance.speaker: Billy Crystal
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Ex-excuse us. I’m sorry, it’s a little crowded. Do you mind if we...

utterance.speaker: Robin Williams
utterance.content: Yeah, could you scooch?

utterance.speaker: Billy
utterance.content: Yeah, move over just a little bit.

utterance.speaker: Robin
utterance.content: Keep on scooching.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So guys, listen, I go over there, and umm...

utterance.speaker: Robin
utterance.content: Why? Why?! What’s wrong with me?!

utterance.speaker: Billy
utterance.content: What’s the matter?

utterance.speaker: Robin
utterance.content: I have a feelin’... I, my wife is sleeping with her gynaecologist.

utterance.speaker: Billy
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: Robin
utterance.content: Well y'know, he’s got access.

utterance.speaker: Billy
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Robin
utterance.content: Y'know it’s that feeling you get, y'know?

utterance.speaker: Billy
utterance.content: Like when you go bowling and you know you’re in somebody else’s shoes?

utterance.speaker: Robin
utterance.content: That’s the one.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, so, so you went to Pete’s...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Robin
utterance.content: Why is this happening to me?! I don’t know, maybe it’s my wound.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Forget it.

utterance.speaker: Billy
utterance.content: So it’s-it’s not heeled yet?

utterance.speaker: Robin
utterance.content: No-no, it’s ooozing, oozing. Could you pass me the cream? Is there any—Oh, there’s the cream.

utterance.speaker: Billy
utterance.content: Thomas, this is gonna be hard, but I wanted it to come from me, and nobody else.

utterance.speaker: Robin
utterance.content: What is it, Tim?

utterance.speaker: Billy
utterance.content: It’s me, I’ve been sleeping with your wife.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So you’re the gynaecologist?

utterance.speaker: Billy
utterance.content: Hey, I’m trying to have a private conversation! Is that okay?!

utterance.speaker: Robin
utterance.content: Ooh, Can I have a napkin, please? Could you please hand me a napkin? Would you--Give me this thing all right!! Enough! And you are no longer my friend! We are finished! Nada!! No more! You are a bastard for doing this!! Get away from me!!

utterance.speaker: Billy
utterance.content: Thomas, come back here!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So Monica, what were you gonna tell us?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, come on, what was the big news Pete wanted to tell you Mon?! Or should I say Mrs. Monica Becker?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No-no-no oh, keep your name, don’t take his name.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He didn’t ask me to marry him.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Ohh.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well then definately don’t take his name.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He wanted to tell me he’s gonna compete is some ultimate fighting competition thingy.

utterance.speaker: The Guys
utterance.content: Pete?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why?! What is it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don’t know exactly. It’s-it’s sorta like wrestling.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, but without the costumes.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And it’s not fake, it’s totally brutal.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s two guys in a ring, and the rules are: “They’re are no rules.”

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So you can like, bite, and pull people’s hair and stuff?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, anything goes, except ah, eye gouging and fish hooking.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What’s fish hooking?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Huh, what’s fish hooking... Thanks man, that would have been really hard to describe. What is that taste?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What? My hands are totally clean, I just gave the duck a bath.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: So thanks for the warm welcome. It’s good to have you guys on my team, and I come to play. I hope you do too. Now, let’s go out there and get ‘em! Huh? And remember, there is no ‘I’ in team.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, but there’s two in martini, soo everybody back to my office.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: You! Chuckles! What’s your name?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh it’s Bing, sir. I’m sorry , I was just ah...

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: No-no, I heard what you said, funny. I like funny. This team is about hard work, but it’s also about having fun. Good to have you aboard Bing!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s right, Ryder. Wynona Ryder for six. Thank you. Yeah, we have the reservations.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right buddy, way to go!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Dude, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thank you! Today, my boss keep slapping my butt and he was acting like it was no big deal.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeesh, what’d you do about it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I didn’t do anything. I didn’t want to be the guy who has a problem with his boss slapping his bottom.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I gotta tell ya, I think it’s okay to be that guy.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe it’s like y'know, that jock thing. Y'know how football players pat each other after touchdowns.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y'know I don’t, I don’t understand guys, I mean I-I would never congratulate Monica on a great stew by y'know, grabbin’ her boob.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I know, for a really great stew you just y'know, stick your head in between ‘em.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, can we please go eat?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah. What are we getting?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Anything but stew.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right so, Chandler, from now on, don’t give your boss a chance to get you. Y'know just ah, don’t turn your back to him.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, or you can teach him a lesson. Y'know? What you could do is you could rub something that really smells on your butt, all right? Then, when he goes to smack ya, his hand will smell. Now what could you rub on your butt that would smell bad?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What if Joey were president?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, hey Rach, can I ask you something?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, you can totally say no, but umm, would it be okay with you if I set Ross up on a date?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, ah with who?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, my friend, Bonnie. She just always thought Ross was really cute, and now that you two aren’t together, she asked if I could set it up, but if you’re not cool with it...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh-oh-oh, which one is Bonnie again?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You remember her from my birthday party two years ago. She’s yeah, like, average height, medium build, bald...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! That’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Great! Okay, good for you!

utterance.speaker: Hoshi
utterance.content: You are iron. You are steel! Let me ask you something, how come when I call your computer support line, I have to wait an hour and a half?

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: I told you, we’re adding new operators all the time. Could we concentrate on my training?

utterance.speaker: Hoshi
utterance.content: It’s just hard when I know I have e-mail I can’t get!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Monica! Hi honey.

utterance.speaker: Hoshi
utterance.content: All right, on the table.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, umm, so listen umm, my friends were telling me a little about this ah, ultimate fighting thing and it, well it sounds really dangerous. I-I don’t want you to get hurt, ‘cause I kinda like you.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Oh, believe me, I don’t want to get hurt either. I’m being smart about this. See these guys? They’re the best trainers in the world, and Hoshi here used to be a paid assassin. A house painter! He used to be a house painter.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Promise me you’ll be careful.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: I promise.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, are we still on for tonight?

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, good, ‘cause umm, well maybe we could have a little workout of our own...

utterance.speaker: Hoshi
utterance.content: No! No boom-boom before big fight!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How ‘bout just a boom?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well that was depressing, I think I just bought a soft pretzel from one of the kids from Fame. Ready to go to the movies?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Um-hmm. Oh wait! This is Bonnie.

utterance.speaker: Bonnie
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: This is Bonnie? This is Bonnie? You’re Bonnie?

utterance.speaker: Bonnie
utterance.content: I can show you an ID if you want?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no, I’m sorry, you look a lot different from the last time I-I saw you.

utterance.speaker: Bonnie
utterance.content: Oh yeah, well I just started wearing bras again.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, that must be it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well I hope you have fun tonight.

utterance.speaker: Bonnie
utterance.content: Thanks! You too.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You said she was bald.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, she was bald, she’s not now.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: How could you not tell me that she has hair?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don’t know, I hardly ever say that about people.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, well, this is just perfect!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well I’m sorry, I thought you said it was okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I said what was okay when I thought she was some weird bald chick. I mean, y'know, that girl has hair got all over head!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, maybe it won’t work out. Maybe Ross won’t like her personality.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why, does she have a bad personality?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no, Bonnie’s the best!

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Bing! Read your Computech proposal, a real homerun. Ooh. Barely got ya that time, get over here. Come on. Wham! Good one. That was a good one. Keep at it team.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What is with him?

utterance.speaker: Phil
utterance.content: With him? You’re is favourite, you’re his guy!

utterance.speaker: Stevens
utterance.content: We never get smacked.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, that’s not true, he-he smacked you once.

utterance.speaker: Phil
utterance.content: Not on purpose, he ricocheted of you and got me.

utterance.speaker: Stevens
utterance.content: I’m telling you, I need some smacks. I got a kid starting Dartmouth in the fall.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Dartmouth? Who went to Dartmouth? Dartmouth sucks. Did you go to Dartmouth Bing?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No sir.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: There you go.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: God Ross, what is that?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s the Ultimate Fighting Combo. Yeah, I saved thirty cents, plus I get to keep the cup. Yay!!

utterance.speaker: Announcer
utterance.content: From New York City, New York! Appearing in his Ultimate Fighting Championship debut! He’s known for his confrontational business style. Ladies and Gentlemen, introducing Pete Beck-errrr!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I love you, Pete!!!

utterance.speaker: Announcer
utterance.content: And his opponent, from Hunnington Beach, California! He’s a 300 pound street fighter, Tank Abbottttttt!!!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Pete! Pete!! That guy’s pretty huge!

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Don’t worry, Hoshi taught me how to use an opponent’s strength and weight against him.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, then that guy is in serious, serious trouble.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right! You go get him! Let’s go!

utterance.speaker: Referee
utterance.content: Here we go gentlemen, here we go! Are you ready? Are you ready? Let’s get it on!!

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Uh-oh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey! It’s me. Mon-i-ca! Can I just tell you how proud I am of you.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: It would be nice after hearing 20,000 people chant “You suck!”

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I mean I-I thought you were nuts at first, but you-you did it. And now you can just look back at this thing with no regrets.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: What, look back?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, you’re not gonna get going are you?

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Well let me ask you a question. Am I the Ultimate Fighting Champion?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, no. But...

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Well I’m not gonna stop until I’m the Ultimate Fighting Champion.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That guy stood on your neck until you passed out!

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Let me tell you a story. When I set out to create Moss 865, do you think it just happened overnight? No. There was Moss 1, that burnt down my Dad’s garage, there was Moss 2 that would only schedule appointments in January, and 862 others that I learned from, just like I learned from this fight, never to let a guy stand on my neck.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You didn’t know that already?

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Look, I’m gonna get better. Okay? I promise you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, just get a lot better. Fast.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Oh, one other thing. Hoshi thinks that you being ringside may have affected my concentration.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah. That-that was the problem.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! How long until Pete’s fight?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, about five minutes. Right now they’re interviewing his opponent. Apparently he trains by going to Iran and pulling the arms off thieves.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hot dog?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Four, please. I’m really nervous. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So Ross, how umm, how did it go with Bonnie?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? Oh! I gotta tell you, I-I wasn’t expecting to like her at all, I mean I actually wasn’t expecting to like anyone right now, but she’s really terrific.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh, that’s too bad!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, I-I’m saying I liked her.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, y'know what, there are other fish in the sea.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Pheebs, I think she’s great. Okay? We’re going out again.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I hear you! Are you capable of talking about any thing else?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey! Which one’s my turkey burger?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ahh, the one next to my foot. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, the fight’s starting!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, we’ll be right in. So ah, did your boss try to slap you again today?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nine times! Okay, I had to put on lotion! But, it’s gonna be okay, because as of tomorrow I’m conducting an experiment, and if all goes as planned, my butt will be smack free.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Fight’s over!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Excuse me, Doug? Hey there sports fan!!

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Bing! You got those numbers for me?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, I ah, I didn’t do them.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Oh, you forgot?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, no I just ah, didn’t do them. Instead, I ah, hung out with a couple of friends and had a couple of beers so I certainly don’t deserve any praise, verbal or otherwise.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Well, I got tanked myself last night. Pretty dicey drive home, Tapanzi Bridge never looked smaller. That’s okay, you’re still my number one guy! Bing!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Doug!!

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m a little bit uncomfortable with the that way you express yourself.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Oh, is it the swearing? I mean is it the constant swearing? Because I gotta tell ya, if it is, you can just... kiss my ass!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, no. It-it’s not about the swearing, it’s more about ah, the way, that you ah, occasionally, concentrate, your enthusiasm on my buttock.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Oh?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, and don’t get me wrong, I appreciate the sentiment. It’s just that I, I have a rather, sensitive posterior, and ah, besides, it’s making all the other guys jealous.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Well, say no more. Y'know it takes guts to bring this up. Bing! You’re okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Ha! Ahhhhhhh!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ahhhhh!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. Would you rather live in the shirt pocket of a sweaty giant, or inside his shower drain?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! No! Look at that! It’s a line of ants! They’re working as a team!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Right, oh yeah. Wow, oh, it looks like Ross is breaking up with her. Uff, I hope he lets her down easy. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Come on Phoebe, look at that! They are not breaking up, look at them. Okay that’s, you know what that is? That is a, that is a second date, that’s what that is! Look at that, she just put her hand on his thigh...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no! That really is nothing, she is very sexually aggressive.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh! Phoebe, this is all your fault! Now he loves her, he’s gonna marry her, and this is all your fault.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You said it was okay!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You said she was bald!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?! What-what-what-what-what?!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Phoebe, we can’t, we just can’t just let it happen! Okay, we have to do something! We have to break them up! Okay? Just go in there and like, shave her head! You owe me one bald girl!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, first of all, breathe. Second of all, I don’t get it. Aren’t you the one that decided that you didn’t want to be with Ross?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well isn’t he your friend? Don’t you want him to be happy?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I just y'know, I didn’t expect him to be this happy so soon. Ufff. Ooo-ooh!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, we killed them all.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: It’s okay, it’s not as bad as it looks, it’s a precaution. Ah, I’m not supposed to move my spine.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Please tell me you’re stopping now.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: I’m fine! I’d fight tonight, if they’d let me. See this circle I’m marking off here? This is my zone of terror.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You are insane! You-you gotta give this up!

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: I can’t until I’m the ultimate fighter. I will do it. I’m telling you, the day will come when children will argue over who will win a fight, me or Superman. Now, I’m not saying I could beat Superman, but y'know, kids are stupid.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Sit down. All right? Please, just listen to me. You are terrible at this! Okay? You are the worst ultimate fighter ever! Ever!!

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Y'know I have a torn rotator cuff, a hairline fracture in my right forearm, and a severely bruised Adam’s Apple, but that really hurt.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well then, y'know what? I care about you to much to watch you hurt yourself like this. So if you have to do this, then you’re gonna have to do it without me.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Well if you’re asking me to quit, then you’re asking me to be someone I’m not. I’ve got to do this.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Then I’ve gotta go. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Mon-Monica?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Could you leave a note? ‘Cause I’m on a lot of pain killers now, and I don’t know if I’ll remember this tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: So, in conclusion, the lines all go up , so I’m happy. Great job team! Tomorrow at 8:30. Phil! Nice job. Stevens! Way to go! Joel-burg, you maniac! I love ya! Bing! Good job, couldn’t have done it without ya.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thank you, sir.

utterance.speaker: Stevens
utterance.content: Oh, excuse me. I forgot my briefcase y'know, by accident.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Of course, you did. Forgot something else too ya bastard! Well, what about you? You’re not feeling left out or anything are ya?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No. No, not at all, that’s-that’s ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Everybody else got one, and you want one too. Don’t you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ye-ye-yeah, yes I do!

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Now get on out of here, you!

utterance.speaker: TV Announcer
utterance.content: Pete Becker is circling the ring now. It looks like, he’s just trying to feel him out. Oh, Bruiser is just...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Run! Run you crazy, rich freak!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I can’t watch this.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Check it out, he’s winning! Pete’s winning!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No-o-o!!

utterance.speaker: TV Announcer
utterance.content: Uh-oh, Bruiser has Becker on the canvas and is going for his favourite area.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh! Oh!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait, if that’s his favourite area, why is he being so mean to it?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, this is ironic. Of your last two boyfriends, Richard didn’t want to have kids, and from the looks of it, now Pete can’t.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Ohh!!
